  • 1/2 cup sour cream

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 60 minutes

â° Total Time: 75 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds ground beef
  • 1 large onion, chopped
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons chili powder
  • 1 tablespoon ground cumin
  • 1 tablespoon paprika
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 can (15 oz) tomato sauce
  • 1 cup beef broth
  • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
  • Cooked spaghetti, for serving
  • Shredded cheddar cheese, for topping
  • Chopped onions, for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat, breaking it apart as it cooks.
  2. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until the onion is translucent.
  3. Stir in the chili powder, cumin, paprika, and cinnamon, cooking for an additional minute to release the spices' aromas.
  4. Pour in the tomato sauce, beef broth, and Worcestershire sauce, stirring to combine.
  5. Season with salt and pepper, then bring the mixture to a simmer.
  6. Reduce heat to low and let it simmer uncovered for about 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  7. Add the kidney beans in the last 10 minutes of cooking.
  8. Serve over cooked spaghetti and top with shredded cheddar cheese and chopped onions.
